segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, creating a widening puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just pouring over the edge, and no one seems to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is too focused on drying the dishes to see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is streaming down the cabinet doors, making them slick and shiny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been overflowing like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm and tidy compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the dishes stacked neatly beside the sink, waiting to be dried.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman needs to turn off the faucet before the kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene is so full of contrasts, calm and chaos, order and disorder.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices the water soon and cleans it up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and I worry someone might slip and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should warn them, but I'm not sure they'd listen.
segments.speaker: PAR
